intro: Alloeochaete oreogena, commonly known as the mountain beardgrass, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Alloeochaete oreogena plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
